item.title: [DERBY-2815] ij doesn't start with J2ME / JSR169 / weme6.1 because attempting to find java.sql.Driver if ij.protocol property is specified
item.description:
When starting ij with the following command:

ij -jcl:foun11 -Xbootclasspath/a:<path_to_jdbc.jar> org.apache.derby.tools.ij -p derby.properties

and derby.properties contains the following:

-----------------
ij.database=jdbc:derby:bladb;create=true
ij.protocol=jdbc:derby:
ij.showNoConnectionsAtStart=true
ij.showNoCountForSelect=true

  1. DataSource properties, only used if ij.dataSource is set
    ij.dataSource.databaseName=bladb
    ij.dataSource.createDatabase=create
    ij.dataSource=org.apache.derby.jdbc.EmbeddedSimpleDataSource
    ------------------

ij does not start and instead gives the following stack trace:
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: java.sql.Driver

The properties file is an example of the 'old test harness' properties files. The test harness would get sql scripts tested with J2ME by stripping away the ij.protocol and ij.database specifications.

In another bug - DERBY-1218 - it was suggested ij.protocol be blanked out (in tools/ij/util.java?) with J2ME.
Another approach would be to check for ij.protocol or ij.database setting when we have a datasource and we're using J2ME.
item.summary: ij doesn't start with J2ME / JSR169 / weme6.1 because attempting to find java.sql.Driver if ij.protocol property is specified

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Attaching a patch to check that if a datasource exists and we've got JSR169, we should not attempt to load a driver.

Maybe just checking for IS_AT_LEAST_JDBC2 would be enough...

I thought about the solution to ignore ij.protocol (and ij.database, for that matter) but on the other hand, we should just never attempt to load a driver with JSR169...

patch 2, prevents loading of drivers with just using IS_AT_LEAST_JDBC2.
For review.

Patch 2 looks good to me, although it's slightly confusing to me that the variable which is false if we're in a Java ME environment is called IS_AT_LEAST_JDBC2, when JSR-169 is based upon JDBC 3.0.

I tried the patch against trunk on linux (FC5) with phoneME Advanced (CDC/FP 1.1), and it worked fine. Without the patch, I got the same error as reported in the description.

+1 to commit

> although it's slightly confusing to me that the variable which is false if we're in a Java ME environment is called IS_AT_LEAST_JDBC2, when JSR-169 is based upon JDBC 3.0.

However JSR169 is not a super-set of JDBC 2.0, so JSR169 does not provide JDBC 2 functionality so IS_AT_LEAST_JDBC2 being false seems correct to me.
I think this issue can be closed.
